e="preserve">Bill Mack (June 4, 1932 – July 31, 2020) was an American country music singer-songwriter, and radio host. He was born in Fort Worth, Texas. He was known for his songs "Blue" and "Drinking Champagne". He was also known for hosting radio shows on WBAP and XM Radio.
Mack died of COVID-19 in Fort Worth on July 31, 2020 at the age of 88.
